metadata.title: CVE-2019-11750 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A type confusion vulnerability exists in Spidermonkey, which results in anon-exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69 and FirefoxESR < 68.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
